title: Extended Triangle
description: Hip openers, Standing Primary body parts engaged Glutes & Hip Flexors, Hamstrings, Shoulders, Spine Calves, Obliques, Triceps Strengthens thighs; stretches legs, hips and shoulders Tones reproductive organs, improves digestion Relieves stress and anxiety How to perform Extended Triangle Begin standing. Step your feet 3 Â½ to 4 feet apart. Bring feet parallel. Bring your arms to shoulder height, palms facing down. Turn your right foot 90 degrees to the right. Turn your left foot slightly in. Reach your right arm out to the right and then down with an exhale. Bring your hand to your shin or ankle. Inhale and reach your left arm toward the sky, palm facing forward. Gaze up toward your hand.
